editorialNotes.tagline: New ways to sketch and animate
editorialNotes.standard: Procreate lets you generate high-caliber artwork at a blistering pace using a robust layering system, stunning filters, and thousands of importable brushes. Plus, Savage Interactive’s super-intuitive app supports pressure sensitivity and Apple Pencil—as well as iCloud Drive and a seamless video recording of each brushstroke—so sharing your work is incredibly simple.
editorialNotes.short: This super-intuitive app makes it simple to paint your next masterpiece.

editorialNotes.standard: Looom (yes, it has three Os) won a 2020 Apple Design Award for pioneering a bold and playful new approach to hand-drawn animation on iPad, accessible enough for anyone to create and enjoy. Starting with a clean canvas, Looom invites you to just start drawing unimpeded by intimidating toolsets or menus. A single touch of the display then captures your first frame. Draw again, capture, and hit play—you’ve created your first looping animation.

name: You Doodle Pro - art on the go

editorialNotes.tagline: Let colors say what's in your heart
editorialNotes.standard: Coloring. It’s fun, creative, and just for little kids. Right? Wrong. Once you get your hands on this virtual coloring book—designed for adults—you’ll wise up to this one simple fact: we never should have quit. Each illustration is wonderful designed, and we loved switching between watercolors, colored pencils, and pens to make every piece unique.

name: Pixel Studio PRO for pixel art

ios.subtitle: Paint it.  Blend it.  Love it.

editorialNotes.short: Create beautiful artwork any time inspiration strikes. 50% off for a limited time
Pick colours from any source and drag-and-drop to and from other apps.

ios.subtitle: Amazing drawing in a few steps
Easy to use hand pose tool

name: PaintHi
